extracted_concepts.definition: A bonus reflecting a character's trained ability, determined by their level, and added to certain rolls or DCs.

rule_logic.premise: A character is proficient with an ability check, a saving throw, or an attack roll OR is calculating the DC of a spell/special ability
rule_logic.implication: Add the character's proficiency bonus to the roll or the DC.
exceptions: Cannot be added more than once to a single die roll or other game effect.
rule_logic.description_text: Every character has a proficiency bonus, determined by your level. This bonus is added to ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls you are proficient in. It is also added to the Difficulty Class (DC) of saving throws for spells or special abilities you use. Your proficiency bonus cannot be added to a single die roll or other game effect more than once.

extracted_concepts.definition: A bonus determined by character or monster level, added to certain die rolls.

rule_logic.premise: An ability check, saving throw, or attack roll rule specifies the use of proficiency bonus
rule_logic.implication: Add the current proficiency bonus to the die roll
rule_logic.description_text: The bonus is used in the rules on ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls.

extracted_concepts.definition: A rule preventing the proficiency bonus from being added more than once to a single roll, even if multiple sources suggest it.

rule_logic.premise: Two or more different rules allow adding the proficiency bonus to a single die roll or number
rule_logic.implication: Add the proficiency bonus only once to that roll or number
rule_logic.description_text: Your proficiency bonus can't be added to a single die roll or other number more than once. For example, if two different rules say you can add your proficiency bonus to a Wisdom saving throw, you nevertheless add the bonus only once when you make the save.

extracted_concepts.definition: Rules governing how multiplication or division of the proficiency bonus is applied, ensuring it occurs only once per roll.

rule_logic.premise: A circumstance or rule causes the proficiency bonus to be multiplied or divided for a roll
rule_logic.implication: Multiply or divide the proficiency bonus only once before applying it to the roll, even if multiple effects suggest it
rule_logic.description_text: Occasionally, your proficiency bonus might be multiplied or divided (doubled or halved, for example) before you apply it. ... If a circumstance suggests that your proficiency bonus applies more than once to the same roll, you still add it only once and multiply or divide it only once.

extracted_concepts.definition: A specific clarification that multiplying the proficiency bonus yields no benefit if the character is not ordinarily proficient in the relevant check.

rule_logic.premise: A feature allows multiplying the proficiency bonus for an ability check where the character would not normally add their proficiency bonus (i.e., is not proficient)
rule_logic.implication: The proficiency bonus is considered 0 for that check, resulting in no benefit from the multiplication
rule_logic.description_text: By the same token, if a feature or effect allows you to multiply your proficiency bonus when making an ability check that wouldn't normally benefit from your proficiency bonus, you still don't add the bonus to the check. For that check your proficiency bonus is 0, given the fact that multiplying 0 by any number is still 0. For instance, if you lack proficiency in the History skill, you gain no benefit from a feature that lets you double your proficiency bonus when you make Intelligence (History) checks.

extracted_concepts.definition: A general guideline that proficiency bonus is not typically multiplied for attack rolls or saving throws.

rule_logic.premise: Considering multiplying the proficiency bonus for an attack roll or saving throw
rule_logic.implication: Do not multiply the proficiency bonus for attack rolls or saving throws, unless a specific feature or effect explicitly allows it (and follows other proficiency bonus rules)
rule_logic.description_text: In general, you don't multiply your proficiency bonus for attack rolls or saving throws. If a feature or effect allows you to do so, these same rules apply.
